recipe.name: Vegan Mushroom Pie
recipe.description: A savory, plant-based mushroom pot pie featuring creamy melted leeks, earthy mushrooms, and herbs, encased in a golden vegan puff pastry crust.

ingredients.ingredient_name: large leeks, thinly sliced (white and pale green parts only)
mixed mushrooms (shiitake, cremini, oyster, maitake, trumpet), sliced
dry white wine, cider vinegar, or apple cider
vegetable stock or plain unsweetened oat milk
aquafaba or melted vegan butter (for brushing)

steps: In a large skillet, heat 2 tablespoons olive oil over medium heat. Add leeks and sauté until softened, 6–8 minutes. Set aside.
Add remaining olive oil to the skillet and sauté mushrooms with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes until browned and most liquid is evaporated, 6–8 minutes. Remove and set aside with the leeks.
In the same skillet, melt vegan butter. Add garlic, thyme, and sage, cooking until fragrant, about 1–2 minutes. Stir in miso paste and cook for 30 seconds.
Add flour and cook, stirring, for 1–2 minutes.
Deglaze with white wine, then slowly add vegetable stock or oat milk, stirring until smooth.
Bring to a simmer and stir in nutritional yeast (if using). Add mushrooms and leeks back to the skillet and cook until thickened.
Transfer the mixture to a 2-quart baking dish and smooth into an even layer.
Roll out puff pastry slightly to fit the dish with a 1/4-inch overhang. Place pastry over filling, seal edges, and make slits for steam. Brush with aquafaba or vegan butter.
Bake for 15 minutes at 400°F, then lower to 375°F and bake for 25–30 minutes until golden brown. Cool slightly before serving.
Cooking success! Now sit back and enjoy your meal.
